properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 25 at 8:57PM EST until January 29 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Jacksonville FL
properties.description:
...The National Weather Service in Jacksonville Fl has issued a flood
warning for the following rivers in Georgia...

Altamaha River At Doctortown affecting Long and Wayne Counties

The National Weather Service in Jacksonville Fl has issued a

* Flood Warning for
The Altamaha River At Doctortown.
* from late Sunday night to Wednesday afternoon...Or until the
warning is cancelled.
* At  8:00 PM Saturday the stage was 11.7 feet.
* Minor flooding is forecast.
* Flood stage is 12.0 feet.
* Forecast...Rise above flood stage by early Monday morning and
continue to rise to near 12.1 feet by Tuesday morning.the river
will fall below flood stage by Wednesday morning.
* Impact...At 12.0 feet...Agricultural and timber lands along the
river begin to flood.
properties.instruction:
All persons with interest along the river should monitor the latest
forecasts...And be prepared to take necessary precautions to protect
life and property. Do not drive cars through flooded areas. If you
see flood waters...Remember to turn around and do not drown.

For graphical hydrologic information...Please go to weather.gov and
click on your state. Select Rivers and Lakes under current weather.
The Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service page provides current and
forecast river information...Gage locations...Impacts... and
historical crest information for all forecast points by clicking on
each point.
